item.content:encoded: Posted by Ye Jia and Michelle Tadmor Ramanovich, Software Engineers, Google Research Automatic translation of speech from one language to speech in another language, called speech-to-speech translation (S2ST), is important for breaking down the communication barriers between people speaking different languages. Conventionally, automatic S2ST systems are built with a cascade of automatic speech recognition (ASR), text-to-text machine translation (MT), and text-to-speech (TTS) synthesis sub-system...

item.title: Machine Learning Pipeline Optimization with TPOT | KDnuggets
item.description: Let's revisit the automated machine learning project TPOT, and get back up to speed on using open source AutoML tools on our way to building a fully-automated prediction pipeline.
item.content:encoded: Let's revisit the automated machine learning project TPOT, and get back up to speed on using open source AutoML tools on our way to building a fully-automated prediction pipeline.

item.title: Loss Functions: An Explainer | KDnuggets
item.description: A loss function measures how wrong the model is in terms of its ability to estimate the relationship between x and y. Find out about several common loss functions here.
item.content:encoded: A loss function measures how wrong the model is in terms of its ability to estimate the relationship between x and y. Find out about several common loss functions here.

item.title: Improving forecasting by learning quantile functions | Amazon Science Homepage
item.description: Learning the complete quantile function, which maps probabilities to variable values, rather than building separate models for each quantile level, enables better optimization of resource trade-offs.
item.content:encoded: Learning the complete quantile function, which maps probabilities to variable values, rather than building separate models for each quantile level, enables better optimization of resource trade-offs.

item.description: The 100 page book on stochastic processes. Published in 2022. This off-the-beaten-path machine learning tutorial is designed for busy professionals, researchers and students eager to learn and apply m...
item.content:encoded: The 100 page book on stochastic processes. Published in 2022. This off-the-beaten-path machine learning tutorial is designed for busy professionals, researchers and students eager to learn and apply methods ranging from simple to advanced, in a minimum amount of time. Offered with data sets, source code, videos, spreadsheets and solved exercises.

item.description: [Summary] tl;dr: A tremendous amount of effort has been poured into training AI algorithms to competitively play games that computers have traditionally had trouble with, such as the retro games publi...
item.content:encoded: [Summary] tl;dr: A tremendous amount of effort has been poured into training AI algorithms to competitively play games that computers have traditionally had trouble with, such as the retro games published by Atari, Go, DotA, and StarCraft II. The practical machine learning knowledge accumulated in developing these algorithms has paved the way for people to now routinely train game-playing AI agents for many games. Following this line of work, we focus on a specific category of games ‚Äì those deve...

item.title: Detecting Signs of Disease from External Images of the Eye | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Boris Babenko, Software Engineer and Naama Hammel, Clinical Research Scientist, Google Health Three years ago we wrote about our work on predicting a number of cardiovascular risk factors fr...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Boris Babenko, Software Engineer and Naama Hammel, Clinical Research Scientist, Google Health Three years ago we wrote about our work on predicting a number of cardiovascular risk factors from fundus photos (i.e., photos of the back of the eye)1 using deep learning. That such risk factors could be extracted from fundus photos was a novel discovery and thus a surprising outcome to clinicians and laypersons alike. Since then, we and other researchers have discovered additional novel biom...

item.title: Auto-generated Summaries in Google Docs | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Mohammad Saleh, Software Engineer, Google Research, Brain Team and Anjuli Kannan, Software Engineer, Google Docs For many of us, it can be challenging to keep up with the volume of documents...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Mohammad Saleh, Software Engineer, Google Research, Brain Team and Anjuli Kannan, Software Engineer, Google Docs For many of us, it can be challenging to keep up with the volume of documents that arrive in our inboxes every day: reports, reviews, briefs, policies and the list goes on. When a new document is received, readers often wish it included a brief summary of the main points in order to effectively prioritize it. However, composing a document summary can be cognitively challengi...

item.title: Why Are So Many Data Scientists Quitting Their Jobs? | KDnuggets
item.description: After speaking to co-workers in the data industry who like me, had left their jobs at a very early stage in their career, I‚Äôve come to realize that there are two main reasons the data science field ha...
item.content:encoded: After speaking to co-workers in the data industry who like me, had left their jobs at a very early stage in their career, I‚Äôve come to realize that there are two main reasons the data science field has such a high employee attrition rate.
